poem:
Ceasefire  
  
On the edge of hope, words scatter  
like leaves in the wind—dust settling  
over the tired walls of Bureij.  
The air, a thin wire strung tight,  
hums with quiet negotiations,  
while in the chambers of pause,   
prayers weave a tentative fabric,  
seeking the fragile dawn.
